title: National Monuments Recall
description: How many of the world's most important national monuments can you recall? Test your geographic memory!

questions.question: Mount Rushmore features the carved faces of four US presidents. Which president is NOT depicted?
The Statue of Liberty was a gift to the United States from which country?
Christ the Redeemer, the iconic 30-meter-tall statue, stands atop Corcovado Mountain in which city?
The Gateway of India, a 26-meter arch monument built during the British Raj, is located in which Indian city?
The Lincoln Memorial in Washington, D.C. features a seated statue of Abraham Lincoln. How tall is the statue?
The Motherland Calls, one of the tallest statues in the world, commemorates the Battle of Stalingrad. Where is it located?
The Moai, mysterious giant stone figures, are found on which remote Pacific island?
The Great Sphinx of Giza, with the body of a lion and a human head, faces in which direction?
The Taj Mahal was built by Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan as a memorial for whom?
The Washington Monument, a 555-foot obelisk, is made primarily of which material?
The Arc de Triomphe in Paris stands at the western end of which famous avenue?
The Great Wall of China stretches approximately how many kilometers in total length?
The Vietnam Veterans Memorial in Washington, D.C. is designed in what distinctive shape?
The Angel of Independence, a victory column on a roundabout, is a beloved symbol of which city?
The Voortrekker Monument, commemorating the Great Trek, is located near which South African city?
